io.dvlopt.linux.gpio

Class GpioDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dvlopt.linux.gpio.GpioDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GpioDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Class for requesting and handling a GPIO device.

    Nowadays, a single machine can have several GPIO chips providing lines. Using this class, the user can request one, obtain information about it and handle it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GpioDevice(int number)
      Opens a GPIO device by number.
      GpioDevice(java.lang.String path)
      Opens the GPIO device located at the given path.

      Obtains a GPIO event handle for a GPIO line.

      Obtains a GPIO handle for handling the requested GPIO lines.

      Obtains information about a particular GPIO line from this GPIO device and writes it to `info`.
      GpioLineInfo requestLineInfo(int line)
      Obtains information about a particular GPIO line from this GPIO device.

      • requestHandle

        public GpioHandle requestHandle(GpioHandleRequest request)
                         throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Obtains a GPIO handle for handling the requested GPIO lines.
        Parameters:
        request - Request specifying what lines will be handled and how.
        Returns:
        A GPIO handle.
        Throws:

      • requestEvent

        public GpioEventHandle requestEvent(GpioEventRequest request)
                             throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Obtains a GPIO event handle for a GPIO line.

        This handle can be used to read the current value of the line or wait for an interrupt.

        Parameters:
        request - Request specifying which line will be monitored and how.
        Returns:
        A GPIO event handle.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - When something fails on the native side.
